If I may, I would like to add my two cents here. With all due 
respect, this is a topic that should not get started. it will be a 
see-saw battle and no one will win. somebody has something different 
to say on who is right and who is wrong. I have seen stories on 
every Ninjutsu instructor out there from Frank Dux to Shoto 
Tanamura, to Hatsumi Sensei himself. so wheather you are Dux-Ryu, 
Genbukan, Bujinkan, Toshindo, Koga ryu, or even *sigh* Ashida Kim 
lets keep the political bickering out of this one and just focus on 
the true ninja history, please?

Mike





--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Richardson Paul <umaryu@y...> 
wrote:
> HI
> 
> the Dux movie where he claims to have ocme form a
> ninja family fought the ultimate contest has since
> been proven fake. He even had a well publicised court
> case between himself and Van Damm which he lost. Even
> Dux military past has been proven fake.
> 
> Hayes, well reading his books, and oing my own
> research it has to say somehting if Hayes and my self
> are in the same org as each other and I wont train
> with him.
> 
> paul
> 
> 
>  
> --- Silk Road School <silk.road.school@i...>
> wrote:
> 
> 
> ---------------------------------
> 
> --- Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@y...> wrote:
> 
> Now, if you want to start quoting Stephen
> Hayes
> (Explanation: I'm currently putting myself through the
> agony of reading his book--and I use that term only
> because it has pages and is bound--about the mystical
> origins of Ninjutsu--insert appropriate oohs and ahs
> here.
> 
> Years ago, when I was working in a bookstore in L.A.,
> I knew some fellows
> studying with Frank Dux as well as some studying with
> Stephen Hayes.  As I
> was certain that Dux was a fraud (a very fast,
> legitimately deadly fraud,
> with some frighteningly effective moves, but still
> nothing like the adopted
> son of an Old Ninja Family that he pretended to be), I
> called up Hayes at
> his studio and asked him something about research.  I
> was thinking about
> getting the store to stock some of his books.  I have
> rarely made anyone so
> nervous in a first conversation.  It set off my
> internal alarms, and I never
> did order the books.
>       Gereg
> P.S.  Ooh.  Ah.  (Almost forgot that.)
> 
>
